Articles.Content: I am playing career mode, and I was wondering if cheats affect how much science you get or something, Because I like to use part clipping cheat to better build my rockets.

i dont think so, i cheated my return from Mun because i was a little bit short on fuel since i wasted too much on the landing,

i still got around 600science for the round trip

Edited October 17, 2013 by lammatt
No, using commands and features from the debug menu will not detract from your score.

You can do a lot of part clipping without having to enable it in the debug menu. I use clipping a lot too, but I never need to turn it on in the debug menu, its about how you place the parts. It's a bit hard to explain, but you can usually coerce most things into clipping into each other without turning clipping on.

OP's wordz translates into, is part clipping thousands of intakes ok with the career mode

well, the fact is, this is still a game how you play according to your own rule. the game doesnt boo you when you cheat as long as you are fine with that
